conclusion: Analyze the given information and the behavior of the ideal gas in the figure to determine the temperature of the gas in state B.
The figure shows a graph of pressure (p) versus volume (V) for an ideal gas.
The vertical and horizontal axes represent the pressure (p) and volume (V), respectively.
The segment BC in the figure represents a hyperbola with asymptotes.
The gas undergoes a change from state A to state B.
The temperature of the gas in state A is given as 300K.
The segment BC is a hyperbola with asymptotes, indicating that the gas expands and contracts in a way that the pressure remains constant.
The gas starts at state A with a pressure of 4 atm and a volume of 10 L.
The gas expands to state B with a pressure of 2 atm and a volume of 20 L.
The gas then contracts to state C with a pressure of 2 atm and a volume of 40 L.
The temperature at state B is the same as the temperature at state A, since the pressure remains constant.
The temperature of the gas in state B is 300K.
